question_text: An administrator finds that the print spooler stops unexpectedly after certain print jobs are submitted. Which two actions can help isolate or resolve this issue? (Select two)
answer_options: Update or reinstall the print driver
Review logs in the Windows Event Viewer
Replace the paper in the main tray
correct_answer: Update or reinstall the print driver
Review logs in the Windows Event Viewer
explanation: Driver conflicts and corrupted spooler-dependent files are common causes. Logs in Event Viewer provide details; updating drivers often resolves spooler crashes.
